Description: Flat, oval, brownish, glazed steatite scaraboid or stamp-seal: engraved and drilled on the base with a lion couchant with three short vertical lines over his back, probably for 'nb tʒwy' (Lord of the Two Countries). Below this a papyrus- and a lotus-plant. There is a hole pierced through longitudinally. Abraded slightly on engraved side with slight green deposit.
Curator's comments: Cf. Petrie, 'Buttons and design scarabs : illustrated by the Egyptian collection in University College, London' Pl. XIII 816 who thinks of the "plants of south and north"; Newberry, 'Scarab-shaped seals' Pl. XIV 36607.
Bibliographic references: Giveon R 1985a / Egyptian scarabs from Western Asia from the collections of the British Museum (p.152, no.52)
Condition: Fair; abraded slightly on engraved side with slight green deposit.
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
